overview_of_class: American fiction written during the boom-and-bust era of 1920-1940 shed light on the social upheaval that we have experienced over the past decade. These works brilliantly portray characters struggling to find meaning in the face of rapid and overwhelming social change. Moreover, in experimenting with new fictional techniques and forms, the authors of this period produced some of our most memorable writing.
name: Studies in American Literature:
subject: ENGLISH
